entry.title: Enhanced Validation for Concurrent Employment and Global Assignment Conflicts - 2H 2025
entry.content:
As part of our ongoing efforts to ensure data consistency and data quality we have added validation to avoid concurrent employment and global assignment conflicts. 

As of 2H 2025 when adding a global assignment to an employee with a concurrent employment the system will show a validation warning about the two conflicting employments:

The same will apply if you add a concurrent employment to an employee on a global assignment:

Why are we doing this?

As per our implementation guide, a global assignment and a concurrent employment cannot be applied to the same employee at the same time (Types of Employment | SAP Help Portal) .  We are introducing this change to ensure the system and documentation are aligned and to reduce the possibility of data inconsistencies. 

What do you need to know?

The validation will come into effect in 2H 2025 if you try to add an active concurrent employment and global assignment at the same time.

This change will not impact employees who already have active concurrent employments and global assignments which exist at the same time. 

This change does not impact on future dated records, for example, an employee has a concurrent employment which ends on 31st December and they go on a global assignment on 1st January

We have introduced the validation as a warning message to give customers time to adjust their processes accordingly. It is planned in 1H 2026 to change the validation warning to an error. If you have a business scenario which allows an employee to have a concurrent employment and global assignment at the same time, you will need to adjust your processes accordingly to prepare for this change.

Please feel free to reach out and leave a comment below this blog post if you have any questions or need further clarification on this process. Your feedback is always welcome!

entry.title: Success Connect: Your People Deserve More Than Just Software - They Deserve Success
entry.content:
Hello, SAP Community!

From Chief Human Resources Officers to HRIS managers to frontline people leaders, HR professionals at every level are navigating an increasingly complex talent landscape. The pressure to create exceptional employee experiences while driving measurable business outcomes has never been greater. Your organization's success depends not just on having the right technology, but on strategically leveraging that technology to transform how you attract, develop, and retain talent. SAP Business Technology Platform and the SAP SuccessFactors HCM Suite work together to help you achieve exactly that.

For Part 2 of this blog series on SAP Connect 2025, I'm excited to spotlight Success Connect 2025. It will provide CHROs with the next steps to focus on strategic workforce transformation, while delivering deep technical content for HRIS managers and HR technology professionals who implement and optimize these solutions daily.

If this is the first time you're hearing about SAP Connect 2025, read this blog first.

 

 

HR Going Beyond Traditional Boundaries

Today's HR leaders face unprecedented challenges. Regardless of your industry or organization size, you're expected to be data scientists, morale builders, strategic business partners, and technology innovators—all while maintaining the employee experience that defines great HR. On top of that, HR leaders are also faced with major obstacles in preparing their workforce for AI. With all these rapid changes in technology, the workforce’s generational differences, and your organization’s moving goals, where do you go from here?

 

By integrating, extending, and automating your SAP SuccessFactors solutions and processes, SAP Business Technology Platform doesn't just support your organization—it evolves it into what it was meant to be. This enables your existing HR processes to transform into the proactive talent strategy that drives measurable business value. Check out  SAP.com/btp-for-HR page for more in-depth information on how SAP BTP helps deliver better and more efficient HCM processes.

Here are my five must-attend sessions at Success Connect that will expand how you think about HR technology possibilities:

 

 

Your must-attend sessions at Success Connect

 

Scenario 1: Integration

 

Your Challenge: HR processes span multiple systems— the SAP SuccessFactors HCM suite and third-party applications —creating fragmentation that leads to inefficiencies, data errors, and poor employee experiences. Read about the related use case here. 

The Solution: Discover how SAP Integration Suite enables seamless connections between SAP SuccessFactors HCM Suite and your entire HR ecosystem. Explore integration use cases for recruiting, onboarding, and data collection, plus strategies for connecting hybrid landscapes with legacy on-premises systems. See how SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh enables you to monitor your event-driven system and manage various aspects of your event-driven architecture. Learn to automate immediate responses for hiring, role changes, and other critical workforce events.

Business Impact: Interconnected HR processes eliminate manual data entry, reduce the time needed to onboard new employees by 50%, and create consistent employee experiences regardless of underlying system complexity. Event-driven integration ensures new employees have system access on day one, eliminates security risks from delayed termination processing, and creates seamless workforce transitions.

If this is you, these sessions should be on your agenda:

 

Maximizing HCM Process Efficiency with Integration Through SAP BTP | HCM1665

Tuesday Oct 7 | 11:15 AM – 12:00 PM PDT

How to Use Event-Driven Integration to Collaborate in Real Time | HCM1682

 Wednesday Oct 8 | 12:30 PM – 12:50 PM PDT

 

 

Scenario 2: Automation

 

Your Challenge: Your employees and HR teams spend valuable time on repetitive tasks, such as managing employee data and records, handling routine processes and more, instead of focusing on strategic HR activities that drive employee engagement and retention. Read about the related use case here. 

The Solution: Explore automation capabilities that streamline recruiting, onboarding, document management, and HR workflows. Learn how SAP BTP helps reduce manual errors while freeing your team to focus on high-value activities that directly impact employee experience.

Business Impact: HR process automation typically reduces administrative overhead by 60% while improving accuracy and employee satisfaction with HR services.

If this is you, this session should be on your agenda:

 

Increasing Employee Efficiency with Automation Capabilities in SAP BTP | HCM1671

 Wednesday Oct 8 | 10:00 AM – 10:45 AM PDT

 

 

Scenario 3: Extensibility and app Development

 

Your Challenge: Your workforce needs mobile access to different HR services, but standard solutions don't address your unique requirements or user experience preferences. The existing processes are prone to errors, making it hard to gain insights from the data. Read about the full use case here. 

The Solution: Explore building a custom mobile app using SAP Build solutions. These solutions make developing an application tailored to your workforce needs intuitive, even for non-technical users. 

Business Impact: With SAP Build's low-code capabilities, a customized application can be built 10 times faster. 

If this is you, this session should be on your agenda:

 

Hands-On Lab: Creating a Custom Mobile App for HR Using SAP Build Solutions | HCM1677

  • Tuesday Oct 7 | 3:30 PM – 4:45 PM PDT
  • Wednesday Oct 8 | 1:00 PM – 2:15 PM PDT

Additionally, a simplified version of the hands-on lab topic of creating a mobile app is being demonstrated at the Integrate and Extend with SAP BTP demo station in the HCM area, when the show floor is open

Enhancing People Profiles with SAP Business Technology Platform | HCM1520

Wednesday Oct 8 | 2:45 PM – 3:30 PM PDT

 

 

Additional sessions that should be in your agenda:

 

AI Technology, use cases and innovation

 

Road map and vision: AI in SAP SuccessFactors HCM | HCM1451

  • Tuesday Oct 7 | 11:15 AM – 12:00 PM PDT
  • Wednesday Oct 8 | 2:45 PM – 3:30 PM PDT

Unlocking and extending the Joule copilot with Joule Studio | HCM1571

Tuesday Oct 7 | 12:45 PM – 1:30 PM PDT

Everything you need to know about AI agents for HCM | HCM1468

Tuesday Oct 7 | 2:00 PM – 2:45 PM PDT

 

 Employee experience via integration and extensibility

 

Drive productivity by integrating and extending your HCM solutions | HCM1081

Tuesday Oct 7 | 4:15 PM – 5:00 PM PDT

 

Technology and administration

 

Fortifying together: Best practices for partner and customer security | HCM1061

Tuesday Oct 7 | 10:00 AM – 10:45 AM PDT

Simplifying your system administration to maximize business continuity | HCM1106

Tuesday Oct 7 | 2:00 PM – 2:45 PM PDT

Road map and vision: Application and technology foundation | HCM1030

Tuesday Oct 7 | 3:15 PM – 4:00 PM PDT

 

 

 

Register Now: Your HR Transformation Starts Here

Success Connect 2025 isn't just about learning new capabilities—it's about positioning your HR organization to lead in the talent-driven economy that's already here. You will gain practical strategies you can implement immediately to transform your HR technology investments into competitive advantages.

Register now for Success Connect 2025 and join the community of HR leaders who are turning people technology into people success. Here’s a great blog from my colleague @rnoia  on SAP BTP for HR at SAP Connect and Success Connect 2025 summary.

 

What's Coming Next in This Series

In the next blog post, I’m joining forces with my colleague Isabelle Joaquin @ijoaquin to dig deeper and provide our recommended sessions for Spend Connect 2025. But don’t let that stop you from registering and checking out the event agenda to see all the sessions offered at Connect here and register!

entry.title: SuccessFactors API using OAuth authentication method via SAP Offline SAML Assertion generator
entry.content:
Introduction

When integrating with SAP SuccessFactors, secure authentication is critical. Since HTTP Basic Authentication is deprecated, SAP recommends using OAuth 2.0 authentication for API access. A commonly used approach is the OAuth 2.0 SAML Bearer Assertion flow, where a signed SAML assertion is exchanged for an OAuth access token.

For scenarios where interactive login is not possible (e.g., background jobs, middleware integrations), SAP provides an Offline SAML Assertion Generator. This tool enables the creation of signed SAML assertions offline, which can then be used to authenticate securely against SuccessFactors APIs.

1. Prerequisites

Before starting, ensure the following setup is in place:

  • API  User: A dedicated SuccessFactors API user exists

  • Certificates:

    Private key available to sign SAML assertions (used by the Offline Generator).

  • OAuth Client: Configured in SuccessFactors, with required API permissions.

Please see below the step by step guide to configure :

TASK 1 - Registering Your OAuth2 Client Application in Successfactors

  1. Create an Odata API user SF_ODATA_API in SuccessFactors with the required permissions:

 

  1. Registering Your OAuth2 Client Application in Successfactors:

 

 

 

By default, the company name will come here:

 

 

 

Now fill the required details:

  1. Application Name: You can use any name here but ideally you should prefer to give a name who will be using the Oauth for connect to the SuccessFactors so that it will be easy for any consultant to understand which Application is using Oauth for SuccessFactors.
  2. Description: Give some logical description about the set up or you can keep this blank as well.
  3. Application URL: You can pass any URL of the company requesting for the setup of Oauth . For example let’s say if my company  is XYZ trying to use this Oauth then you can put the URL as https://xyx.com , if CPI is using this Oauth then provide the CPI URL here https://XYX6Z.tmn.hci.eu1.hana.ondemand.com , if google is using this then give https://google.com.
  4. Bind to users: (Optional) You can enable this option to restrict the access of the application to specific users including business users and technical users. This is not required to check.
  5. User IDs: Ideally, we don’t bind with users so that anyone can access it. It is required if you enabled the Bind to User option (if point 4 is enabled), Enter the user IDs separated by comma who can only access the Oauth.
  6. X-509 Certificate: Click the button below to Generate X.509 certificate and it will open a window as shown below:

Click below button:

 

It will open a window as shown below:

 

 

  1. If you see closely only one field is mandatory here i.e. the common Name (CN) and here, you can put the Odata API username which you have created in the first step i.e. SF_ODATA_API.

 

 

  1. Please fill the username in the Common Name (CN) field and click on generate: After you click on Generate the below window will open. Download and copy the certificate and keep it in your local folder.

 

 

 

  1. Click on Register so that API key will be generated: Once you click Register then it will take you to the below screen:

 

 

 

 

 

  1. Click on View to see the API key:

 

 

  1. So, the registration is successful in Successfactors and till this step we have the below details with us: Keep all the information in your local drive so that you can find it quickly.

 

  1. Odata API user: SF_ODATA_API
  2. X-509 Certificate: Please note you can use the certificate from the downloaded file in the step no 8 when you open the downloaded file you can see two things inside the file one is the private key encrypted and other one is Begin of certificate and end of certificate. Please note we must choose the Private key encrypted file for the SAML generation later using command prompt in this document.

 

 

 

  1. API Key:

 

                  You can also edit, disable, and delete an OAuth2 client registration.

TASK 2 - Generating a SAML Assertion

Generate a Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) assertion for requesting an OAuth    token. I am going to explain how you can generate the SAML Assertion locally.

  1. Downloading the Maven file

You can download the maven file using the below link, this will help us to generate the SAML assertion which we will be using for the Oauth call using the postman: https://maven.apache.org/download.cgi

 

Download the below Zip file:

Binary zip archive     apache-maven-3.9.6-bin.zip

 

 

Click the link above and download the zip file in your local PC: The file will look like as shown below.

 

 

Unzip the file and keep in the below folder in C drive.

 

 

 

  1. Install the JDK latest version, you can easily get the free version if you search in google.

Choose the one which is required for your operating system. When you download and install, it will create the file in C drive as shown below:

  

 

 

  1. Use the command prompt and pass CD\ to go to the root directory i.e. C drive.  

     

Press Enter and you will use the below steps to confirm that maven and JDK installed :

  1. CD\: To go to main directory
  2. echo %JAVA_HOME%: To check the Java Home
  3. java -version to check whether jdk installed properly with which version.      

              

 

  1. cd C:\apache-maven-3.9.6\bin: It will reach the directory C:\apache-maven-3.9.6\bin
  2. Use mvn -v to check the Maven Apache version as seen below.

 

  1. Now we are confirming that Maven and JDK latest version are installed in the system.
  2. Change the system environment variables by searching the settings in the start button of your PC.

 

  1. Click on the environment Variables and below window will open:

 

Click on New and add the below details both in User variables as well as the System Variables, give the variable name as PATH and variable value as the location of the maven file, in my case it is stored in C drive. Similarly, give variable name as JAVA_HOME and give the variable value as the location of the JDK file as given below Please follow the below and add in both new user variable as well as in the system variable:

Variable Name: PATH

Variable value: C:\apache-maven-3.9.6\bin

Variable Name: JAVA_HOME

Variable value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-21

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Click Ok and you can see both the path and press ok to proceed. You can see now both the path has been updated.

 

 

  1.    Go to the attachment of the KBA , 3031657 - How to generate SAML assertion using SAP-provided offline tool - SuccessFactors - SAP for Me and download it and keep in C-drive.

 

Unzip the file and keep it in the c: drive as shown below:

 

Open the folder and open SAMLAssertion.properties as shown below:

 

When you will open SAMLAssertion.properties file you will find some dummy entries inside it, and we need to clean it and use the details which we have in TASK-1.

 

 

 

After cleaning the dummy value, the screen should visible as shown below:

 

Now we need to fill the details:

  1. token URL: https://<SF API URL>/oauth/token for example it should be something like https://api12preview.sapsf.eu/oauth/token.
  2. ClientID: API Key which you received while registering the client in Successfactors in our case the ClientID is  

     

      . You can refer above in TASK-1 step no 10.
  3. userName:The username(Odata API user we have used in CN name i.e. SF_ODATA_API)
  4. privateKey : The certificate we have copied from the manage Oauth from SuccessFactors at Task-1 step no 10.
  5. expireInMinutes=100000 ( Maximum possible value is 5258880)
  6. Save everything as mentioned above in a file and then run the script as mentioned below.
  7. Command -   cd C:\SAMLAssertionGen-master

 

 

  1. Press enter to go to the directory C:\SAMLAssertionGen-master

 

  1. Execute the below command now.

mvn compile exec:java -Dexec.args="SAMLAssertion.properties”

 

Press Enter:

It will start generation the saml assertion and you can see the here how it started but the actual saml assertion which we need to call the API in successfactors using Oauth we will be finding it at the end of the saml generation.

 

 

Assertion:

 

 

Once completed, it would generate SAML assertion. Copy this and store it securely in your local drive.

 

TASK-3 Calling ODATA API from Successfactors using Postman.

 

Now we have all the details with us, for example:

  1. SuccessFactors company ID
  2. SF API Key (from Manage Oauth)
  3. SAML Assertion

We must do two steps to query the data from the success factors Oauth.

  1. First Step: In this step, we will be calling the SuccessFactors to get the Oauth token. Please see the screenshot:

 

 

company_ID: Successfactors instance company id

client_id: API Key from the SuccessFactors Manage Oauth2 (Refer Task-1)

grant_type: urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:saml2-bearer

Assertion: SAML assertion generated in Task-2 (Refer to the last steps)

 

Now we have the token, we can move to step-2 to query the data from the SuccessFactors.

  1. Second Step: In this step we will be using the token generated in the above step and query the data from the SuccessFactors. Please see below screenshot.

 

 

You have put the query to get the data and select Authorization as Bearer token. In the Token field pass the token we got in the Step 1 and query the data. The query will be successful, and you will be getting the data.

 

 

You can export the collection from the postman and can share with the third party so that they can directly use this to set up to query the data using Oauth from SuccessFactors.

entry.title: CREATE AND ASSIGN AUTHORIZATION POLICIES IN IAS
entry.content:
Introduction

SAP Identity Authentication Services (IAS) provides secure access management for SAP cloud applications. One of the core features in IAS is Authorization Policies, which allow administrators to control access to applications and resources based on defined rules.

In this blog, we’ll go through the steps to create and assign authorization policies in IAS, ensuring only the right users have the right level of access.

Why Authorization Policies Matter

  • Control user access based on attributes like group, role, or user ID

  • Enforce compliance and security requirements

  • Provide flexibility for hybrid or multi-application scenarios

  • Simplify administration by centralizing access control in IAS

Please follow the step by step process to create authorization policies in IAS :

HOW THE IAS SUPER ADMIN CAN CREATE AND ASSIGN AUTHORIZATION POLICIES IN IAS

  1. CREATION OF AUTHORIZATION POLICIES

This document tells you how you can assign the authorization policies or give admin access to Granular level to HR managing their own HR Organization and division. This will help to give granular access to HR admin in IAS by creating the authorization policies in IAS so that they can see only the employees belonging to their organization unit and reset the password for them.

We are creating the custom Policies for customers as we have different divisions and organization, and we would like to give access to the HR managers to their respective divisions accordingly.

The screen shots below are for your reference from the test system, and you can use the same step for production as well.

Prerequisite: You have SUPER ADMIN access to IAS tenants in which you are going to create the authorization policy.

IAS Tenants:

For Test: https://XXXXXXX.accounts.ondemand.com/admin/

  1. Login to the test IAS System:

Give the URL https://XXXXXXX.accounts.ondemand.com/admin/ in the browser and the below   window will open.

  1. Give your Email or Username and password to login to IAS an ADMIN and click on continue.

  1. You will see the login screen of IAS as shown below:

 

  1. Not go to the “Application Resources” and click on the tenant settings :

Here , you can go the policy-based authorization and enabled the option in the right context window.

  1. Now go to the “Application Resources” section and click on the SuccessFactors application.  

  1. Click on the applications and it will show you the screen below.    
  2. Go the Administration console as shown below under the System Application. You can see below highlighted one:

 

  1. Now you can see to the right-side pane of the screen with Authorization policies.  Click on that and you will see the screen below.

  1. Click on the create button and give a name for which you want to create a new policy. It will ask for the Policy name and the Base Policies. We have given a name as IMAS_AUT_USER as an example to show and giving access to Read the users and update the users’ details in IAS (Identity Authentication services).

  1. Now click on the create button and it will take you to the screen below:

  1. Here click on the + sign and it will take you to the screen below where you can choose the user. Division and assign the division according to the employee export file. 

  1. Choose for both the restrictions + Sign and choose user. division for both the places because we would like to give admin access to HR to see and update only the users belonging to those division.

13. Now we need to find the value from the SF export file as attached here to see what the value is coming from the SuccessFactors for the organization/division and use the exact same field value here.

PFA.

 

  1. Check the column AS and field name custom06 value and use the same value in the above user.division field. In our case we have set up rules for AUT, so we need to filter column06 from the exported file from SF and search for AUT. We go custom06 value as AUT(AUT). This value needs to be updated in the user. Division value . ( Please note you need to fill this custom06 values from Successfactors to each user in IAS by using the source and target transformation) .

Source transformation code :

            {

                "sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:successfactors:2.0:User']['customFields'][?(@.customFieldName == 'custom06')]['value']",

                "targetPath": "$.custom06",

                "optional": true

            }

Target transformation code :

{

                "sourcePath": "$.custom06",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:enterprise:2.0:User']['division']"

            }

  1. The same value we need to update in the user. Division field as shown below.
  2. At the end you can add the below authorization as well USE schemas.READ_SCIM_SCHEMAS click on ADD USE and select from the dropdown the authorization as USE schemas.READ_SCIM_SCHEMAS. This is also required READ_SCIM_SCHEMAS authorization policies. Otherwise, you won't be able to see and access the Export Users’ title.

  1. Click on confirmation and it will be added.

  1. First click on SAVE and then click on the Assignments tab and add the user you would like to give this   authorization.

  1. Assign/click on ADD to add the users whom you want to give granular authorization. Please note that the user should exist in the IAS User directory. Now I am giving access to one user for example Mohana@gmail.com

 I can click on add and search the user using the email address and add the user. After that the user is assigned to the new authorization policy and the user can access the employees belongs to AUT organization.

 

  1. Search for the user whom you want to give access to.

  1. Click on the ADD.  The user is added successfully.

The above steps complete the creation of the new Authorization policies and assignment of users.

HOW TO ASSING AUTHORIZATION TO HR ADMIN/ ANY USERS USING THE EXISTING AUTHORIZATION POLICIES  

  1. Follow the steps from 1 to 7 and complete the steps as mentioned above. ( The above example shows the process , now you want to assign other users in the same authorization policies)
  2. Now you are in the authorization policies tab, and you need to click on the filter to easily access the custom packages created and choose the one required for you to be updated. Please note that IMSA_AUT_USER is the test Authorization policy. I have created many authorizations policy for each division, that is why you can see many customer packages but here I am assigning the user to only IMSA_AUT_USER authorization policy.

  1. Click on the filter and choose customer packages.

  1. Click ok to see all the customer packages filtered and you can choose the one required for you. I am choosing the IMSA_AUT_USER and would like to assign one existing user.

  1. Now open the customer authorization policies named IMSA_AUT_USER. You can choose the package as per your requirements. I would like to give access to the below user for the authorization policies IMSA_AUT_USER.

  1. You must click on the IMSA_AUT_USER authorization policy as shown in the above step. It will show you the screen below. Go to the assignments tab and assign/add the above user.

Click on the ADD and search for the user with username as BHR.

Now the user has assigned the authorization policies created by you. You can reset the password for this user in IAS and try to login and you will see that this user will be able to see only a few users who are belonging to the division AUT(AUT). 

Please note : You must remove the user from Administrator group if it is assigned as an administrator otherwise the Administrator group in IAS under user & Authorizations->administrator will give more permissions to the administrator.

entry.title: SuccessFactors Crossboarding in mini-EC environment : Insights to consider
entry.content:
Problem statement: The customer were using S/4 HANA as their HRIS system. The customer were also using Employee Central (EC) including Position Management, but without the true flavor EC functionalities such workflows, alerts etc. In this landscape, S/4 HANA is system of truth, and SuccessFactors is a "slave" system with ESS/MSS functionalities being restricted to view only.

The customer were keen to use Crossboarding (XB) to collect additional data and new set of paperwork from their crossboardees.

With SuccessFactors EC being a view only application, the traditional XB processes such as Employer/Employee review were not working. In the employer review the data were not getting displayed at all. In the employee review step also, no data were being displayed where the system was forcing you to update the email address with your personal address. Since no data were being displayed, the system throws and error, and you were unable to move forward.

Note: I did open a SAP ticket and the processor indicated the config looks correct and the ticket need to be escalated to product engineering.

Design thought: After looking at few options, and none of them "really" working that will make it meaningful, I tried the following:

- Created a process variant with only Additional Data Collection and Document Flow. (Since crossboardee are an existing employee, I did not see any real benefit in having personal data collection step).

Crossboarding Process Variant

 - I created a business rule for employment profile selection (Refer to this link to know more about employment profile selection: Employment profile selection )

Business rule - Employee profile selection

 

 (Note: You can use any condition in your if clause. The rule is required to evaluate to true for the rule to trigger)

- The employee profile selection works similar to ReHire. Hence, to support this process, I created the dynamic group

 Note: Since S/4 is the system of truth, the rehire check is done on the S/4 side, when the data is replicated from SuccessFactors.

- I added the employee profile selection in the config step: Manage Data >> Onboarding Configuration.

- Additional data collection and forms were configured and the appropriate business rules were configured.

There are really 2 scenarios to test the Crossboarding scenario:

- When the internal candidate is pushed from Recruiting to Onboarding

- When S/4 updates the employee record with new position info, the updated records is replicated to SuccessFactors. When the appropriate event reason (action/action type in S/4) is used, the system will automatically trigger crossboarding.

Scenario 1:  In this scenario, the internal candidate is processed in Recruiting, accepts offer and Onboarding is initiated. When onboarding is initiated, the record should be available in Employment Profile selection for further processing.

Note: You will see a card in the home page for New Hire Data. You click on the card, and you will see a tab for Employment profile selection.

 

 When you click the Employment Profile Selection option, the crossboarding record is displayed. (This is similar to what we see in ReHire scenarios)

 In the displayed record/page, select the option "Matching Employment". Scroll to the bottom to process the internal hire.  You are required to highlight/select the crossboardee record for the option "Process as internal hire" to be enabled. When you click the option, the record is processed as the Crossboardee.

What I found is, with the employment profile selection, I was able to circumvent/bypass the limitation of employer/employee process step when ESS/MSS were permissioned for view only.

 After completion of the employment profile selection, the crossboardee / internal candidate get a card on their home page to provide additional data to complete the crossboarding process. This is similar to the onboarding experience. 

 

 Scenario 2:  When the updated employee record (with the new position/job information) is replicated from S/4 to SuccessFactors, the business rule automatically triggers crossboarding.

In this scenario, the employer/employee review steps are not initiated. The system automatically triggers additional data collection for the crossboardee to complete.

Note:  In the onboarding dashboard if you have any internal candidate onboarding records (which were pushed prior to this configuration) do not restart the onboarding process. Restarting will automatically trigger crossboarding, but the system will process it as an onboarding process instead of crossboarding.

Conclusion: This design thought, configuration really helped in setting up crossboarding process, making the entire user experience seamless and easy to use.

entry.title: Managing Misconduct in SAP Successfactors : An MDF-Driven Approach
entry.content:
Introduction :
In this blog we will explore handling misconduct cases by creating a dedicated section in SAP Successfactors Employee Central, this section will help business take the right action based on based on structured inputs.

Context : 

A while ago a customer requested a section for Misconducts that will be visible for Managers and there is going to be a workflow for HR to approve of the misconduct to be applied on their direct reports.

Solution Overview :

An MDF to be Placed on People Profile that will generate Sanctions to be applied on employee based on Inputs done by Managers.

We will need 4 MDFs 

[1 for Misconduct Types , 2 will be a parent and child MDF essentially to work as a table that we will lookup upon, 1 Will be visible on the Employee Profile] 

Flow of the Process :

In my case it was the manager who initiates the sanctions, So once the manager selects the misconduct & Occurrence it will propagate sanctions to be applied on the employee and once save HR will choose to approve or decline.


Creating the MDFs :

1- Misconduct Types : This will be all Misconducts types in the business list plain and simple , we will create all of these misconducts via Import and export 
Example :
Type of a Misconduct

 
2- Now we will head to Parent & Child MDFs , Parent will be same as Misconduct type it will just work as a container of the upcoming mdf as it just feels better to keep track without modifying in the source so, Now in the Child Object 
we will create fields like [ Misconduct Types we will refer to the previous MDF we created in this one , 1st Time , 2nd , 3rd , 4th these fields depending on the business as it will contain the deduction amount/ or some might be just a warning] 

Example : 
Misconduct Details working as a Container for all types of Possible Misconduct and their Sanctions

 

 

We will Import Misconduct Details which is Misconduct Type & Sanctions to be applied for each occurrence.

3- MDF to be Visible in the People Profile :
This MDF will be placed in a section on People Profile ,but before that we need to set the business rule that will help the Manager choose the correct sanctions to be applied based on the Internal Policy we got.

I did make it on change and to be placed on a field in this MDF as per the customer desire you can make it on save.
Business Rule :

 

This will cover the 1st time ,so you will need to do the rest to cover all the sanctions.

Now this is how it's going to look like once manager chooses the inputs :

 
At the end once it's saved a workflow will be sent to HR to either approve / decline.

Conclusion : 

This setup is just the starting point for managing misconduct in a clear and consistent way in SuccessFactors. With a few MDFs, rules, and a workflow, managers can take action and HR can stay in control.

This is first step I'd say ? The next blog would be automating it so it posts directly the deduction in the Non Recurring Pay Component Section and make sure it's replicated to Payroll.

Thank you all for your time.

entry.title: Mapping multiple pay components from SuccessFactors Recruitment to Employee Central
entry.content:
In this article we will discuss an issue relating to mapping multiple pay components from SuccessFactors Recruitment to Employee Central.  This is particularly useful when you want internal hires to go to Manage Pending Hires rather than initiate Onboarding.

In the application template we are saving the amount, frequency and type for four different pay components.  When we move the candidate into Manage Pending Hires we see that there are  multiple rows of data.

The first check was to create a rule trace to see if an Employee Central rule was creating this extra line.  The rule trace confirmed that it was not related to a rule.  

In the mapping template we had multiple rows for each pay component.

The multiple mapping rows for each pay component was causing the issue.  You do not need to map the code, amount and type as three different mappings.  You only need to map one line as shown below, as the amount value sets the pay component with ‘.1001’.

<mapping-attribute><source entity-type="application" refid="offer_HOURLYrateofPay"/><target refid="payComponentRecurring.paycompvalue.1001"/></mapping-attribute>

The frequency does not need to be mapped as this should default from rule in Employee Central.

As mentioned on a previous article you can send internal hires to Manage Pending Hires and review the data there for internal hires before deciding whether you need to initiate an onboarding process.
